wikipedia_page.main:
Frances Bessie Burlison (2 May 1875 – 12 January 1974) was an English sculptor, graphic artist, and interior designer.
Burlison was born St. Pancras, London, on 2 May 1875. She was daughter of John Burlison, of Burlison and Grylls, and Elizabeth Sarah Grylls, sister of his partner Thomas Grylls. She was educated initially by a governess and then at the Slade School of Fine Art.Her first exhibited works were presented with The Society of Lady Artists in 1898. Other works include the war memorial at Beaumont College and the reredos at Our Lady, Ramsey.
